# Combine Datasets

Combine the indicator dataset with the actual data.

```{r}
gp_data <- read_csv("input_data/EN_INDICATOR_VALUES.csv") %>% 
           left_join(indicators, by=c("INDICATOR_ID"="INDICATOR_ID")) %>% 
           rename(INDICATOR_NAME=NAME) %>% 
           left_join(read_csv("input_data/EN_T_SPATIALUNIT.csv"), by=c("SPATIALUNIT_ID"="SPATIALUNIT_ID")) %>%rename(UNIT_NAME=NAME) 
```

## 1. Value for a given Municipality / Indicator

Questions : what to do with the year? integrate explicitly in the question or just take max as standard?
```{r}

filtered_indicators <- gp_data %>% 
  group_by(INDICATOR_ID, short_desc, questiontype) %>% 
  summarize(rand_val=sample(VALUE,1), rand_year=sample(YEAR,1)) %>% 
                        filter(questiontype<=2)

indicator <- filtered_indicators$short_desc

random_value <- filtered_indicators$rand_val

indicator_id <- filtered_indicators$INDICATOR_ID

indicator_year <- filtered_indicators$rand_year

municipality_id <- c(100)

municipality <- c("ZÃ¼rich")

questions_and_queries <- tibble(
                          questions = c("how high is the {indicator} in {municipality}?", 
                                       "which municipality has the highest {indicator}?",
                                       "Which municipality has the minimum {indicator}?",
                                        "what are the highest, lowest and average {indicator}?",
                                        "How many municipalities have a {indicator} higher than {random_value}?",
                                        "How high is the total {indicator} in the Canton Zurich?"
                                       ),
                         
                           queries=c("SELECT VALUE FROM TABLE WHERE INDICATOR_ID = {indicator_id} and BFS_NR={municipality_id}", 
                                       "SELECT UNIT_NAME WHERE INDICATOR_ID={indicator_id} and VALUE=MAX(VALUE)",
                                        "SELECT UNIT_NAME WHERE INDICATOR_ID={indicator_id} and VALUE=MIN(VALUE)",
                                        "SELECT MAX(VALUE), MIN(VALUE), AVG(VALUE) WHERE INDICATOR_ID={indicator_id}",
                                        "SELECT count(*) where INDICATOR_ID={indicator_id} and VALUE> {random_value}",
                                        "SELECT VALUE from TABLE WHERE INDICATOR_ID={indicator_id} and UNIT_TYPE=8"
                                    }"
                                      )

)



dataframe <- tibble(
              question=purrr::map(questions_and_queries$questions, 
                                   ~glue::glue(.x)) %>% unlist(),
              sql=purrr::map(questions_and_queries$queries, 
                                    ~glue::glue(.x))%>% unlist()
              )

write.csv(dataframe,"questions_queries.csv")

```
